thread.title: DJOKOVIC TAMES NADAL IN BANGKOK EXHIBITION
thread.title_full: DJOKOVIC TAMES NADAL IN BANGKOK EXHIBITION

title: DJOKOVIC TAMES NADAL IN BANGKOK EXHIBITION
text:
Home » sports » DJOKOVIC TAMES NADAL IN BANGKOK EXHIBITION DJOKOVIC TAMES NADAL IN BANGKOK EXHIBITION Lerpong Amsa-ngiam October 2, 2015 1:00 am 
World No 1 Novak Djokovic World no 1 Novak Djokovic stamped his authority over arch-rival Rafael Nadal 6-4 6-2 in the "Back to Thailand Nadal-Djokovic" tennis exhibition in front of the sold out 6,5000 capacity Hua Mark Indoor Stadium on Friday. The present and ex world No 1 players were engaged in serious tennis game just like their professional match but it was the Serbian who was sharper and more aggressive as he finished off the Spaniard in just 64 minutes. Earlier Both players had taken part in tourism promotional activities including a visit at the Erawan Shrine where there was bomb attack last month which resulted in 20 deaths. They also visited Prime Minister Prayut h Chan-ocha at the Government House. The PM also conducted a brief tour for the players at a nearby market and showed them Local products. Djokovic and Nadal left Bangkok after the match on a chartered flight to enter their next tournament in China. 14 Viewed
